oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-01-04 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from January 4, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Roy Acuff (host/performer) and his Smoky Mountain Boys, guest performer Johnny Cash, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Howdy Forrester, June Webb, Jimmy Riddle, Minnie Pearl, and Bashful Brother Oswald. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 952nd broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rod Brasfield; Johnny Cash; Howdy Forrester; June Webb
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Roy Acuff -- Pins And Needles (In My Heart) (Roy Acuff) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Roy Acuff) -- Roy Acuff introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Roy Acuff) -- Roy Acuff introduces Johnny Cash -- Ballad Of A Teenage Queen (Johnny Cash) -- Prince Albert commercial (Rod Brasfield, Roy Acuff) -- Roy Acuff introduces Howdy Forrester -- Golden Eagle Hornpipe (Howdy Forrester fiddle) -- Roy Acuff introduces June Webb -- I'm So Lonesome I Could Cry (June Webb) -- Roy Acuff talks -- Won't It Be Wonderful There (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Forrester, Howdy, 1922-1987; Bashful Brother Oswald; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982; Webb, June, 1934-; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Cash, Johnny
